data.title: Improve internationalization support for projects
data.body:
Currently, the Godot editor uses `.po` files (gettext), and projects use [CSV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comma-separated_values).

CSV has a few downsides compared to `.po` or other more common formats for localization:

- it is not very VCS-friendly (having a large amount of different languages in a single file makes it worse),
- it is not compatible with most localization platforms (like [Transifex](https://www.transifex.com/) or [Weblate](https://weblate.org/))

Using a more advanced format could also bring support for advanced i18n features like plurals.

data.title: Queue RPC packet before calling method locally to ensure correct RPC â€¦
data.body:
Queue RPC packet before calling method locally to ensure correct RPC packet order.
Fixes #9151

example of what this fixes:

rpc("a");

sync func a
  rpc("b");

sync func b
  return;

on the server of execution will be: a is called, then b is called.
on the clients: b is called, then a is called.

this occurs as the server calls the local method before sending off the network packet about the RPC. 
this code changes it so the RPC is queued then calls the method.

data.title: RegEx fixes #9382

data.title: [3.0] with the changes to physics_body_2d, I see no way to get the collision on a KinematicBody2D
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux Ubuntu 64bit commit 8caa21a4a939dbb8d7b8a7fa14ca8b5a32fc1be9

**Issue description:**
since the dissapearance of "is_colliding" and the modifications on physics_body_2d.h and .cpp, I can make a KinematicBody2D work correctly, since all the new modified functions require the ID of the collision to work, like get_collision_normal() or get_collider()
#before:
```
if (is_colliding()):
		var n = get_collision_normal()
```
#now:
```
#not sure if the following line works
if( get_collision_count() != 0 || get_collision_count() != null ):
		var n = get_collision_normal( THE_COLLISION_ID )
```

I have not been able to find away to get the collision or if there is a collision after a KinematicBody2D "move()", this feels like a chicken and egg situation

data.title: [2.1.4 Beta] OUYA console works now but the OUYA Controller is broken.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Godot Engine 2.1.4 Beta, Windows 10, OUYA/Android(Release 4.1.2)

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

When I saw that a new patch #4944 by Marcelo Fernandez has been applied for the 2.1.4 Beta release of Godot, I knew that there wouldn't be any further problems for the OUYA to crash when using the controller. After uploading one of the template projects to see how good it runs the game works and the controls are operational.

Well, the controls barely works. The joysticks and the trigger buttons (L2 & R2) does not work right whatsoever. the Left joystick uses joy axis 1 and 3 while the Right joystick does not use any axis number at all. Then the (L2 & R2) buttons are not responding when I push the button in. The other buttons work but other than that, I do see progress that exporting to the console is more tollerable. However, this controller issue needs to be dealt with.

I have uploaded a new demo project "OUYA_Debug" so then everyone can clone it and open it in the Godot Engine to export and run it on the Android Console to test the controls.

**Steps to reproduce:**

This is an Android Console but there is a lengthy setup to get the game project exported to OUYA
1. On the OUYA's dev website, Cortex Devs: (https://devs.ouya.tv/developers/docs/env_setup) read the Environment Setup to allow the game console to connect to your computer with the right configuration to the adb.exe and google usb connection software. [PLEASE NOTE THAT THE INSTRUCTIONS SAYS THAT IT WORKS ON WINDOWS AND MAC. CAN'T GUARANTEE LINUX SUPPORT FOR INSTALLING OUYA. SORRY.]

2. On the Godot Docs, the documentation is explanatory if you need info or a refresh on how to export games to android: http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/learning/workflow/export/exporting_for_android.html

LENGTHY yes, but it does work.

**Link to minimal example project:**
https://github.com/Corruptinator/OUYA_Debug (Use this to export to OUYA)

data.title: "Clone to position" shortcut
data.body:
I think it would be convenient to have the ability to create and place clones of an object with one action. This would be really handy for placing collectibles or other objects all around your scene quickly.

Currently you must select an object in a scene, hit Ctrl-D then drag the cloned item to its position; this shortcut would let you place a clone of the selected object with Ctrl-Shift-click, placing the clone where you've clicked. This would also extend to holding down the click so you could line up the object correctly before placing it.

In practice it would look something like this (taken from GameMaker Studio): 
![lavishlightheartedindochinesetiger](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27100585/27523114-6b221b82-5a6e-11e7-8e13-1c1a37fd39aa.gif)

Any discussion or thoughts are welcome.

data.title: tree fix drawing order for header and removed indentation for custom bg colours
data.body: - the collapse arrow gets drawn after the background so its not hidden underneath anymore - custom_bg_color no offset anymore ## issue: ### before: ## after: the collapse arrow is now drawn after the bg so it is not cut of. also the offset doesn't affect the background anymore as a result the inspector looks even less chaotic, less distraction.

data.title: RegEx captures grab too much
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10
Visual Studio 2015
Godot 3.0 (current build)

**Issue description:**
RegEx of "(ab)(solve)" with the input "absolve" results in the following captures in get_group_array() returning `[absolve, solve]` instead of `[ab, solve]`.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a root node with a built-in script:
`extends Node`
`var regex = "(ab)(solve)"`
`var expr`
`func _ready():`
`expr = RegEx.new()`
`expr.compile(regex)`

Then connect a child TextEdit's on_text_changed event to a function on the root node:
`func on_TextEdit_text_changed(content):`
`var obj = expr.search(content)`
`if obj != null:`
`print(obj.get_group_array()`

The resulting list will have both entries with "absolve".

I'm reverting this temporarily. Echo events are sent without the echo property set, breaking several things. Please figure out why this is happening at make a PR again
Reverts godotengine/godot#9350

data.title: Export method as button in inspector
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
3.x I guess

**Idea**
Just an idea but I think it's worth discussing. 
I think it might be useful to export method in from a node so it would show up as a button in the inspector. Clicking the button would run exported method. Script using such feature would have to use `tool` keyword of course. 

I saw @kubecz3k have been using setgets in his Finite State Machine plugin for similar behavior - you can write state name into exported string and then setget handles creation of the state (or something like that, I haven't read the code yet). I think my idea is cleaner approach for tools working in editor.

**Example**
```gdscript
tool
extends Node2D
export var something = "foo"
export my_func "Create Foo" # function name, button text

func my_func(): # no parameters!
    # do something
    # no return, runs purely for side effects
```
![insp-bttn-mckp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4397533/27520350-aac40f76-5a09-11e7-9f4e-072a874b17b1.png)

**Downsides**
I'm not sure if inspector is good place to that kind of functionality. On the other hand writing editor plugin that adds few buttons to toolbar seems to be overkill to me. As an alternative to my idea I'd suggest putting exported functions/buttons in the toolbar when the node is selected - editor would handle adding/removing button automatically.
![mkp2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4397533/27520387-ffd88f2c-5a0a-11e7-8749-3941b850a81a.png)

What do you think?

data.title: Update import dock when editing a resource from the inspector
data.body:
If you need to change the import settings of a resource you are editing, its very boring to have to find said file in the FS dock first.
With this change, once you select the resource to edit it, it will update the import dock to reflect that file.

not sure if this is totally clean the way it is now, or if we should reset the import dock when something different is selected in the scene tree. Not very relevant, but..... WDYT? :)

After I installed the export templates to the Godot engine, I went into the export tab to see if all the export options are clear and ready to export, but when I clicked on the "Windows Universal" Export it says that no export templates are found, please download and install the templates.

data.title: Input event gets fired for all instances of node
data.body:
**Windows 7 / Godot 2.1.3**


**Input event gets fired for all instances of node**
I dynamically add nodes to a GridContainer during runtime. I was expecting, that an Mouse-Input-Event is only fired for the node that is below the mouse but events are fired for all nodes.



**Steps to reproduce:**
**-Create a scene with a GridControler**
**-Create another scene with a Control and add some instances of the Control into the GridController**
**-Implement a simple input-handling-function in the Control like this**
```
func _input(event):
	if (event.is_action_pressed("touch")):
		printt("touched ",  mPosInGrid.x,  " / ",  mPosInGrid.y)
```


**Link to minimal example project:**
[Test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1100633/Test.zip)

data.title: RegEx::search should return an empty RegExMatch in mis-matching cases versus a null Object.
data.body:
**Context**
Windows 10
Visual Studio 2015
Godot 3.0 (current build)
I'm relatively new to messing around with the Godot internals, so I apologize if I simply don't understand something.

**Issue description:**
RegEx::search supposedly returns a null object when it fails to match something and a RegExMatch object when it successfully makes a match (in GDScript). However, I'd suggest that the returned object from the function be a RegExMatch object regardless. Just have an "empty" one with no matched content.

**Suggested Action**
I believe the only change that needs to occur is line 1375 of `modules/regex/regex.cpp`, however I'm not sure what to change it to (from NULL) that would be most efficient and prevent memory leakage.

My guess is that returning `Ref<RegExMatch>(memnew(RegExMatch()))` is inefficient, but when I tried updating it to `Ref<RegExMatch>(nullptr)` or the former on a branch in my fork, neither appeared to fix the problem.
